> One of my peers is running a JUnit test that he wrote and it appears that
> JUnit is initializing his test class for each test. He invokes the
> TestRunner in the main method of the class. Is this standard or something
> we're doing wrong.

You're doing nothing wrong.  If you take a look at the TestSuite.java
file, you will notice the line:

      addTest((Test)constructor.newInstance(args));

so adding a test to a TestSuite is in fact adding a new instance of the
Test class.

-Vladimir
